author: Helen Rooney
text:
I have sold on ebay for years and did a bit on Deepop too, but I will never use Vinted again after just one sale 

I sold a dress to a buyer and sent proof of delivery. The post office marked the postcode slightly wrong on the proof of postage. The package was slightly delayed, as most Royal Mail packages are at the moment due to Covid. The buyer worried that it hadn't arrived and raised it with Vinted on the 5th day. Vinted automatically refunded the buyer, telling me it was because the post code was wrong. Vinted do not seem to understand that even if the postcode is wrong Royal Mail will deliver it to the correct address as the correct address was marked up on the package. 

I contacted the buyer to ask her to send it back when she got it. She was super honest and told me she had just got the package and everything was correct, including the postcode, She has now been told by Vinted that she will need my bank details to send me the money once she gets a refund as she wants to keep the item. 

If Vinted would have allowed a few days grace and had a better understanding of the UK postage system this whole issue would not have happened. They need to train their staff better

author: Morgane
text:
J'ai vendu une paire de chaussures de mon mari. Le mardi 2 septembre, l'acheteur a confirmé la réception et la satisfaction. J'ai demandé que l'argent soit transféré de mon porte-monnaie électronique à mon compte bancaire, mais malgré le courriel de confirmation, le transfert était en attente. Le lendemain, j'ai contacté le support pour demander des explications et ils m'ont dit que c'était normal, que parfois il faut 48h et donc d’attendre. Après 48h, le transfert est toujours en attente et le support a eu le courage de me dire qu'ils doivent enquêter pour comprendre le problème et que je devrai attendre des semaines. Nous avons vendu ces chaussures très chères parce que notre bébé a besoin d'une intervention urgente. Désespérée, j'ai essayé de téléphoner à Mangopay et une dame très gentille m'a répondu qu'elle ne voyait aucun problème avec mon paiement et qu'elle contacterait Vinted immédiatement pour faire débloquer le transfert. Malgré tout cela, Vinted n'a pas encore débloqué mon paiement de 3000€. Mon avocat m'a dit qu'il s'agissait d'un détournement de fonds et que Vinted serait légalement responsable si quelque chose arrivait à mon enfant, mais il est pire et je me sens impuissante et désespérée parce que Vinted ne me donne pas l'argent pour payer l'intervention. J'ai fait part de la gravité de la situation à Vinted mais, de toute évidence, ils ont plus intéressé par les intérêts bancaires sur mon argent et de celui d'autres utilisateurs malheureux (je suis sûre que je ne suis pas le seule dans cette situation) que par la santé de mon enfant.

I sold a pair of my husband's shoes. On Tuesday, September 2nd, the buyer confirmed receipt and satisfaction. I requested that the money be transferred from my e-wallet to my bank account, but despite the confirmation email, the transfer was pending. The next day, I contacted the support team to ask for explanations and they told me that this was normal, that sometimes it takes 48 hours and therefore to wait. After 48 hours, the transfer is still pending and the support had the courage to tell me that they have to investigate to understand the problem and that I will have to wait weeks. We sold these very expensive shoes because our baby needs urgent surgery . Desperate, I tried to phone Mangopay and a very nice lady told me that she saw no problem with my payment and that she would contact Vinted immediately to get the transfer unblocked. Despite all this, Vinted has not yet released my payment of 3000€. My lawyer told me that this was a misappropriation of funds and that Vinted would be legally responsible if anything happened to my child, but he’is worse and I feel helpless and desperate because Vinted is not giving me the money to pay for the surgery.I have told Vinted about the seriousness of the situation but obviously they are more interested in the bank interest on my money and that of other unlucky  users (I am sure I am not alone in this situation) than in my child's health.
title: ARNAQUE SCAM

author: Rose
text: I recently sold a watch over Vinted. Unfortunately the straps were damaged during postage, and it arrived broken. Naturally, the buyer complained. I contacted Vinted support, confident that they would be able to help me. I could not have been more wrong. It turns out that they assume all their sellers are lying cheats, who would deliberately sell broken items. They offer no help or support, and are incapable of reading the messages sent to them. Every message I received from Vinted felt like a slap in the face, and I will never ever buy of sell on this website again. I can not advise more strongly against using the awful website.
title: The worst experience of my life.

text:
I’ve not received any assistance from Vinted. I received an item totally different his description and Vinted ask to me pay return cost in order to obtain a reimbursement. Despite must pay 0,7€ + 5% of amount for protection which basically doesn’t exist. Unfair marketplace, to be kind. I also work for the second globally marketplace after Amazon and I can’t image a worst place for buyer. My aim is to draw the attention of EU committee for trade and Spanish consumer associations and also in Italy, my native country. Please image if I had received a second hand dirty socks in the box instead of a Gucci bag and for Vinted I should have pay sending back expenses to recover my two thousand euros. 
One solution: chargeback and delete account.

text: I think the app is great and useful, but I think they have a long way to go in terms of user experience.
